dcterms:description: A word spotting experiment conducted to test the response time of participants based on the gender of the speaker producing the target word.
dcterms:title: Word Spotting Experiment

dcterms:description: The list of 1500 most frequent words in the French language, used to select words for the experiment based on frequency and emotional neutrality.
dcterms:title: 1500 Most Frequent Words in French

dcterms:creator: J. H. Ryalls
P. Lieberman
dcterms:description: Study on vowel perception and the impact of fundamental frequency (F0) on the identification of vowels.
dcterms:title: Fundamental frequency and vowel perception

dcterms:creator: R. L. Diehl
dcterms:description: Study on male-female differences in the phonetic realization of vowel categories.
dcterms:title: On explaining certain male-female differences in the phonetic realization of vowel categories

dcterms:creator: E. Strand
dcterms:description: Study on gender stereotype effects in speech processing.
dcterms:title: Gender stereotype effects in speech processing

dcterms:creator: D. S. Sokhi
dcterms:description: Study on how male and female voices activate distinct regions in the brain.
dcterms:title: Male and female voices activate distinct regions in the male brain

dcterms:creator: S. Lattner
dcterms:description: Study on voice perception, focusing on sex, pitch, and the right hemisphere's involvement.
dcterms:title: Voice perception: Sex, pitch, and the right hemisphere

dcterms:creator: M. Owren
G. Cardillo
dcterms:description: Study on the roles of vowels and consonants in discriminating talker identity versus word meaning.
dcterms:title: The relative roles of vowels and consonants in discriminating talker identity versus word meaning
